paragraphs: Wellington, or Te Whanganui-a-Tara in Māori, was long inhabited by Māori iwi who used the natural harbour for food gathering and travel. It was a vital location for waka navigation.
The city became the capital of New Zealand in 1865, chosen for its central location. European settlers developed it as a political and cultural hub.
Today, Wellington is the capital city, known for its vibrant arts scene, wind, coffee culture, and as the home of New Zealand’s government and national institutions.
